name: The Coast Village Inn & Cottages

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and makes you feel at home. The cottage we stayed in was adorable and very clean. Loved the beautiful waterfall! We can't wait to go back!!
reviews.title: We loved it and we'll be back!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Coast Village Inn and Cottages is a great place to stay. We stayed in the hotel room and everything was nice and clean. The staff is very friendly. We recommend it and we'll be back for sure !
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: A perfect weekend away for the celebration of my mother-in-law's 70th birthday was made possible only because of the wonderful staff at The Coast VIllage Inn and Cottages. We were not the easiest guests. We rented a larger cabin for my mother in law and ended up with three mini-cabins. We made and cancelled and changed reservations up until and even after some of us had checked in. All changes were accepted with a smile and the feeling that I was working with a good friend and not with someone i'd never met. We were given heaters for the cooler nights and even had a birthday cake and flowers in the cabin when we checked in. The cabins are comfortable and close enough/far enough from each other to be able to enjoy the evenings with close friends yet have complete privacy. The customer service at the Coast Village Inn and Cottages is EXCEPTIONAL and was MUCH APPRECIATED. I will never stay anywhere else in Wells and highly recommend this property.
reviews.title: Love this place - and the staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Coast Village Inn is a great place to stay while exploring the south Maine coast. It is convenient to all the attractions in the area. We explored from Portland to Kittery from our base at the Coast Village Inn. There are many restaurants nearby along Highway 1, and a large shopping center is a 30 second drive north.
reviews.title: Wonderful cottages

reviews.text: While this Inn does have standard motel rooms, I feel the best thing about this place is the cottages. They have some large cottages, but my wife and I chose one of the Overnight Cottages. They are about the size of a regular motel room, but are stand alone buildings made of wood. They look like they were built in the 1940's. The furniture is old, as are the fixtures in the bathroom. But, to us, that was part of the charm of the cottages. Everything was spotless clean. There is a small fridge and a tiny 13 inch TV on the wall. A nice feature is a screened in porch.
reviews.title: Feels like home

reviews.text: We stayed a week in the Sand Dollars Suite. When we entered the suite, I was very pleased since it looked exactly as the pictures on the site. And overall, everything was better than expected. Beds were comfortable, kitchen appliances, dishes, utensils, everything was of good quality (sturdy steak knives, etc.) Only thing missing was a coffee machine in the suite but I had brought my own.
reviews.title: We will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Furniture comfortable, decoration very nice and the unit was very clean. I slept in the room in front and was not bothered by the noise of the street. We appreciated the ceiling fan in the rooms.
reviews.title: Shop Around; You can do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fair price for quality of unit and very nice staff and excellent management
reviews.title: We had a wonderful time here.

reviews.text: We hope to be back next summer.
reviews.title: Hotel could use some work but all together worth the price.

reviews.text: Cleanliness and friendly front office are the best features if you don't mind road noise from 7:00 am to past midnight. Rooms are within fifty feet of Route 1 near a traffic light, so trucks, cars and motorcycles are constantly accelerating and decelerating out front. The suites building is a converted old house which has renovated rooms, but allows noise to be heard, alog with slamming doors and cooking odors from the lower floor.
reviews.title: Cozy and Quaint...

reviews.text: Over the last few years we have had the pleasure of staying a the Coast Village Inn for summer vacations. This year we spent a week . We had the pleasure of meeting Asia upon our arrival. She is the manager,of the Inn, from the moment we arrived we felt like we were at home. She was friendly, professional and accommodating.
reviews.title: Perfect!!

reviews.text: The Inn is kid friendly and clean! our kids loved leaving the beach and having the option of swimming in a pool.
reviews.title: Good Value-Needs Some TLC and Upgrades

reviews.text: The pool is spotless, and kids have the option of walking in the shallow end and swimming out into the deep end.The staff at the Inn is friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend the Inn .Asia makes you feel like you are staying with family! I would highly recommend the Inn for a family vacation or a weekend getaway!
reviews.title: Looking forward to another visit
charge my debit card $200.00 unauthorized use
reviews.text: Thank you,
E.Casey
reviews.title: By far the most Wonderful Family Getaway

reviews.text: We just came back recently from a one week stay at the Coast Village Inn where we rented one of the housekeeping cottages. First off, in terms of location, if your go to place is Wells Beach, you are well located as it is very close. The trolley can take you there pretty quickly. If, like us though, you prefer Ogunquit beach, it is a bit out there, definitely not too bad of a drive, but by trolley you'd have to take two. That, of course, is all on us, we knew where we would be in relation to the beaches - Just a note for people maybe less familiar with the area (i've been going to Maine for 30 years).
reviews.title: Ok place

reviews.text: I would say the property is decently maintained. The pool is nice, the water was pretty warm being in the sun all day and the slow progression from shallow to deep end was nice (it would be wheelchair accessible).
reviews.title: Needs a little TLC, but they're working on it and are very friendly.
VACATION RENTAL FROM HELL
reviews.text: The lay out of the place is ok. I would say, that because of the position of our cottage though, while we had privacy, being farthest away from the road, we did have less of a homey feel - we were facing the side of the motel part and at night would see the bright red neon Hampton Inn's sign.

reviews.title: We had a great time. Perfect for a "Girls time away" before summer camp. We will be back!
reviews.text: As for the cottage itself - size was ok. The bedrooms were of a nice size, but the living area was on the smaller side. When we arrived there was a big hole in our screen porch, for which we got tape from the front desk to fix. One of the four kitchen chairs was also broken and left on the porch (apparently the customer right before us had broken it). The front porch, other than the hole, and being pretty narrow, was nice and looked like it was built in more recent years.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were comfortable and the place was clean. A few things though i'd point out. Though I am sure the bed sheets had been cleaned, there were a bunch of hairs (5 or 6) between the covers. I am guessing it was probably from whoever made the bed. Not a huge deal, but you know...Also, the kitchen didn't have a microwave. I expected that a cottage that mentions it has a "fully equipped kitchen" would've had a microwave - notwithstanding the fact that the property sign in front listed "microwaves' as the first feature. (I will note that the lady at the front desk was nice and told my husband she'd try to get one for us, but I guess it didnt work out because we never heard anything back - nice of her to try nonetheless). The unit also did not have an electric coffee maker - they did offer coffee in the front office, but would've been a nice little feature to have (at the low cost of cheap coffee makers and microwaves nowadays, seems it would be worth the investment). Also, the water was a bit of a pain. For the hot water to come on, you would have to run the water for quite a while, and when it finally did kick in, it was pretty difficult to adjust the temperature. The water seemed to be either kind of cold or very hot.
reviews.title: My wife and I enjoyed the cottage, and hope to return next year

aka: The Coast Village Inn And Cottages
description: Nestled on 3.5 acres of beautifully landscaped property, The Coast Village Inn & Cottages is located in the quaint seaside town of Wells, Maine. A short trolley ride from Wells Beach, we offer a range of accommodations including guest rooms, vacation suites and private cottages. Our beautiful gardens feature a zero entry outdoor pool as well as a picnic and grilling area; the perfect place to gather and relax with your loved ones.
